intro: Polygala guantanamana var. alternifolia, commonly known as the Guantánamo polygala, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are alternate, typically narrow and lance-shaped, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces delicate, often yellow or greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
